definition: lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
variant of 蛇[she2]
snake/serpent/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to add/to increase/to replenish
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample

sentences.english: Comment upon this would be to paint the lily.
sentences.chinese: 对此发表评论无异于画蛇添足。

sentences.english: For such a beautiful girl to use make-up would be to gild the lily.
sentences.chinese: 对一个这样漂亮的女孩来说，化妆简直就是画蛇添足。

sentences.english: Whatkind of painting should the propeller use?
sentences.chinese: 螺旋桨喷漆真的是画蛇添足吗？

sentences.english: That’s the story of "Draw a snake and add feet to it."
sentences.chinese: 这就是“画蛇添足”的故事。

sentences.english: The man who added a feet for the snake had not drank the wine.
sentences.chinese: 可以回答，最后那个画蛇添足的人没喝到酒。

definition: to do more than is required (idiom); superfluous/gilding the lily
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
to overreach oneself/to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
pinyin: hua4 hu3 bu4 cheng2 fan3 lei4 quan3

definition: to buy a wooden box and return the pearls inside/to show poor judgment (idiom)
to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
to paint a dragon and dot in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
out of place/inappropriate/incongruous
lit. the voice of the guest overwhelms that of the host (idiom)/fig. a minor player upstages the main attraction/minor details obscure the main point/the sauce is better than the fish
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
superfluous
irrelevant/beside the point
